details.summary:
We develop and maintain relations between the United Kingdom and Burundi.
The British Embassy Liaison Office is a subordinate Post to the British High Commission in Kigali. We deal with a wide range of political, commercial, security and economic questions of interest to the UK and Burundi. The British Embassy Liaison Office in Bujumbura can offer limited consular assistance to British Nationals in Burundi.
details.description:
Benedict Llewellyn-Jones OBE has been British High Commissioner to Rwanda and non-resident Ambassador to Burundi since January 2011.

Mr Llewellyn-Jones joined the Foreign and Commonwealth Office in 2007. He has previously served in the UK’s permanent Representation to the EU in Brussels and as Head of the Zimbabwe team at the FCO in London.

Mr Llewellyn-Jones is a graduate of the University of Oxford. He has considerable career experience in policing and drugs and crime policy, climate change policy and African affairs.

Mr Llewellyn-Jones is married, and has one daughter.
details.services:
We provide limited consular assistance to British Nationals in Burundi. We facilitate the renewal of British Passports for British Nationals in Burundi.

We support British businesses loooking to expand their business interests in Burundi.

Enquiries BHC.Kigali@fco.gov.uk Tel: +250 252 556000 (British High Commission, Kigali)

details.summary: We develop and maintain relations between the United Kingdom and Rwanda.
details.description: We deal with a wide range of political, commercial, security and economic questions of interest to the UK and Rwanda. The High Commission and its liaison office in Burundi provide consular assistance to British nationals in Rwanda and Burundi.
details.services:
Visas

For information on whether you require a visa for the United Kingdom and how to apply go to the UK Border Agency website

Births, deaths and marriages

Information on how you can register a birth or death which occurred overseas, and legal documents for couples marrying or entering into civil partnerships abroad.

Passports and emergency travel documents

How to renew or replace your British passport when visiting the UK and information on getting replacement travel documents if your passport is lost or stolen.

Travel advice

Information on staying safe and avoiding problems when living or travelling abroad, with links to our embassies, high commissions and other diplomatic posts across the world.

Legalisation Service

How to get official confirmation that your UK public documentation is genuine so it can be accepted by foreign authorities. The UK does not require any documents to be legalised for use within the UK.

Disabled Access

The British High Commission and DFID Rwanda are accessible to disabled visitors.

We do not have a specific disabled access route at the main entrance to our compound, but disabled visitors may enter through the main vehicle gate with one escort. As with all visitors, the High Commission guards will use the hand-held metal detector to check all visitors and their possessions, and will secure mobile phones and other sensitive objects such as cameras in a key box.

Visitors can retrieve their possessions on departure. The High Commission guard force will be on hand to provide any assistance required.Please phone the High Commission in advance if you would like to discuss access arrangements.
